column4: maybe I should go the manual way, of changing the apt sources file?
yesterday I was all day on an edgy workstation, my brain must have borked
ok, now back to the question
can I update from feisty to gutsy using the cdrom as apt source?
actually, not the cdrom, the mounted loop cd image
I don't have a cdrom in this machine
you can add it as a cdrom apt source and yes you can then use it to upgrade to gutsy
how can I do that if I don't have a cdrom drive? (this is one of the reasons I'm trying to upgrade, I have a SATA cdrom which panics the kernel)
you can mount the iso image and then use it as a cdrom apt source
could you please paste me a line for a cdrom source, I don't have any in my sources files, I don't know the syntax
where are you mounting the .iso file?
actually I found a line... deb cdrom:[Ubuntu 6.04 _edgy Drake_ - Alpha i386 (20060310)] / edgy main restricted
well if you are going to mount the .iso
you should use something like:  deb file:/home/jason/debian stable
where /home/jason/debian should be changed to the mount point of the iso
I think I got it, trying now, thanks!
